statement.p:
Consider the curve y={{f}} defined on the interval [{{a}}, {{b}}].
Set up a definite integral that computes the arc length of this curve.
Use appropriate technology, such as Wolfram Alpha, to compute this definite integral. (The integrand probably doesn't have an antiderivative!) Report your answer to at least 6 decimal places.

ol.li: The arc length is computed via \displaystyle\int_{ {{a}} }^{ {{b}} }\sqrt{1+ \left({{fp}}\right)^2}\ dx.
The value of this integral is {{arclength}}.
